sub_title: STA Technical Leader at Ford Trucks International
summary:
Supplier Tech Assistance Technical Leader with a demonstrated history of working in the automotive industry. Leading more than 100 suppliers across Europe and Asia Pacific Regions which of those particularly manufacture variety of products including Chassis, Electrified Powertrain, and Transmission components. 

Highly skilled and certified in core automotive tools like APQP, FMEA, PPAP, SPC, MSA and the rest of IATF & Ford CSR features. Having utilized 6-Sigma techniques to resolve several complex quality issues by ending up an outstanding outcomes.

awards.title: The Best Program STA of 2012
awards.description: Award was granted by Assistant General Manager of Purchasing, Cengiz Kabatepe, thanks to the contributions throughout the whole launch phases of V362.

profile_positions.description: Ensuring F-Trucks’ fastly expanding and growing European Supply Base running with best quality & sustainable capacity
profile_positions.title: Expat - STA Site

profile_positions.description:
Leading Ford people & Suppliers as Contamination SME (Subject Matter Expert) in EMEA Region - certified by Ford North America Core STA team.
Leveraging in high voltage battery manufacturing field where the particular focus is on key processes and constraints of array production.
Taking leadership over contamination avoidance strategies as part of industrialization and manufacturing feasibility phases (cleanliness lab implementation, washing machine process setting, deburring operations e.g.)
Guiding suppliers to resolve high-cost warranty failures to do with contamination issues.
profile_positions.title: STA Site Contamination Subject Matter Expert

profile_positions.description:
•	Suppliers under my responsibility are mainly producing commodities like plastic injection moulding parts, rubber compounds including cabin air suspensions, engine cooling hoses, and metal tubes as well as the whole tire-manufacturers (chassis PMT) are audited and evaluated by myself.
•	Managing suppliers for flawless launches at all brands (Schedule A, Capacity Planning and Verification, PPAP (Production Part Approval Process), supplier process AIMS-Automated Issues Management System issues resolution) throughout all pre-production launch stages.
•	Driving continuous improvement in manufacturing excellence throughout the supply base both in Turkey (%80 domestic) as well as the facilities in Europe, North Africa and China.
•	Managing the progression of key suppliers to achieve Q1 and manage the deployment of the Q1 process and disciplines in whole supply base.
•	Driving deployment of Quality performance requirements, initiatives and training to supply base in STA tools (e.g. Warranty Reduction, Benchmarking, Lean Manufacturing, Reliability and Robustness, G8D (Global 8 Disciplines) methodology, PFMEA (Process Failure Mode Effect Analysis), SPC (Statistical Process Control), Gage R&R (Repeatability and Reproducibility), etc.) as required
•	Leading new manufacturing location evaluations and Quality data to support sourcing activities of Ford purchasing for either new projects or ongoing carlines.
•	Maintaining Quality-related database for assigned suppliers in order to sustain highest capability of supply base.
•	Having full responsibility for containing supplier quality concerns related to Stop Ship/Build, common cause BSAQ (Balanced Single Agenda for Quality) projects, Fie) and Field Action Stop Ship/Prevent Action in whole product range including Transit, Courier and Cargo units.
•	Supporting resolution of special cause supplier quality BSAQ projects by way of utilizing 6-Sigma problem solving and presenting to Ford top management.
profile_positions.title: STA Site Engineer (CV Car, B Car, Cargo, Engine, Transmission)

profile_positions.description:
– Responsible for the quality of powertrain components used in serial production being received in a supply base across the globe
– Participating in site visits to audit the suppliers as needed basis based on Q1 & MSA procedures
– Providing STA plant coverage for all launch programs from 1PP build through
launch (including added starter programs).
– Supporting launch reviews as required and provide interface with PVT/Plant.
– Assisting Site Engineers as required in disposition of PPAP packages.
– Assisting STA Site Engineers as required in completion of Supplier Run-at-Rate
reviews.
– Supporting Site Engineers as needed in identification and resolution of chronic
external Supplier quality performance issues.
– Supporting the plant incoming quality (IQ) department in selection of Supplier
attendees for the monthly IQ meetings.
– Assisting Suppliers and plants in resolving Supplier challenges to QRs,
including PPM input
– Communicating best practices and lessons learned across other associated
STA Programs
– Working with PVT to functionally approve all resourced products
– Supporting the PVT/Plant Variability Reduction Team (VRT) in analyzing
Supplier warranty and initiating corrective actions in order for reducing R/1000 and
CPU indicators.
– Supporting PVT-led high-mileage reliability projects
– Supporting / Leading plant-specific 6-Sigma projects to improve both quality and to reduce redundant costs
profile_positions.title: STA Resident Engineer (CV & B Car)

profile_positions.description:
– Responsible for V36X new program launches' supplier-based (both domestic & european) quality follow up on following variability reduction teams such that chassis, powertrain, electrical and interior from verification of prototype phase to OK-to-buy (completion) stage.
– Supporting the program team in identifying High Impact Suppliers
– Communicating program requirements between the appropriate
Purchasing Managers, Buyers, and Engineers in VOME (Vehicle Operations Manufacturing Engineering)

milestones

delta parts, Launch Readiness and Run-at-Rate reviews, and
disposition of PPAP packages for Segment III & IV High Impact
Suppliers as directed.

drive resolution of Supplier quality issues - AIMS follow-up.
– Reviewing Segment III & IV High Impact APQP status as directed.
– Supporting the program with campaign prevention and driving best practices
across the supply base.
– Ensuring STA databases are updated with program-related information.
– Participating in facilitating warranty sharing Letters of Agreement (LOA).
